snippet: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo’s much-questioned decision to disband the Moreland Commission has scuttled an inquiry into the income of legislators like Sheldon Silver who also have other jobs.
abstract: New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo’s much-questioned decision to disband anticorruption panel Moreland Commission scuttles inquiry into income of legislators like Sheldon Silver who also have other jobs.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo’s much-questioned decision to disband the Moreland Commission has scuttled an inquiry into the income of legislators like Sheldon Silver who also have other jobs.

headline.main: With Panel Gone, a Move to Monitor New York Lawmakers’ Income Is Thwarted
headline.print_headline: With Panel Gone, a Move to Monitor Lawmakers’ Income Is Thwarted

keywords.value: Moreland Commission to Investigate Public Corruption (NYS)
keywords.name: organizations
